comments.commentBody: You can't ensure Bernie will remain in the Democratic party, because he doesn't want to stay there.  In fact, if he didn't need the party's structure to be a viable candidate he wouldn't have joined up in the first place.  When Bernie fails to win the nomination, he'll only stick around if he thinks he can get changes to the party platform.  If that doesn't happen to his liking he'll drop the party in a New York minute.

Don't you know that the Keystone project would have resulted in something like 35 permanent jobs? Do you really think we should have despoiled the environment for hundreds of miles (against the wishes of farmers, etc.) and enabled the risk of huge costly spills, while promoting the addition of more carbon/pollution to our atmosphere, for 35 jobs?

Of course environmentalists want jobs. But the Keystone project would not have delivered them.
Maybe you should look into the facts some more.  I pay way more than 30% all told, even after deductions.  I'm not the problem.
Come on, that project had no longterm value.  Only a handful of permanent jobs would have been created, in the service of extremely dirty fossil fuel that would add to the glut.

The jobs of the future are not the same as the jobs of the past.  The changes began with the inevitable development of technology plus the creation and expansion of the internet.  These two factors, coupled with individuals and enterprises using these tools and infrastructure to connect to global markets, weakened the unionized labor force.  These occurrences were NOT caused by  any particular political party, but rather by the inherent effect of "connectivity" between markets and individuals.  Having said this, from a Labor force perspective, there IS a significant difference between the Democrats and the Republicans.  Which party has continually supported 1) improved working conditions, 2) Equal Pay for Equal Work, 3) Maternity Leave, 4) ant-Discrimination Laws, and 5) an increase in the Minimum Wage?  The Democrats!  The Republicans, as a whole, have NEVER supported these efforts.
There are also movies about vampires. When was the last time you've seen one?

Vietnam is still a relatively poor country, and can't really afford to buy expensive U.S.-made weapons. Thus, the lifting the arms embargo would be an important albeit mostly a symbolic gesture. After this, the U.S. and other more wealthy nations, such as Japan and South Korea who are also threatened by China, should take steps to support Vietnam (including providing direct military assistance) so that Vietnam has the means to become a stronger foot soldier as part of a larger efforts to contain China's rise.
Regarding the basis of improved U.S-VN relations or the the lifting of the arms embargo, if the standard is based solely on Vietnam's record on human rights, it will be very easy for the pro-China elements in the Vietnamese Government (regrettably there are some) to sabotage the process simply by arresting a few dissidents or protestors in a very public manner on the eve of President Obama's trip. It would not be surprising if over the next few days, the pro-China elements in Vietnam suddenly become more aggressive in ordering arrests of political dissidents or protestors in order to interfere with the improving U.S.-VN ties. If they do occur, President Obama should simply ignore them and proceed with his trip to Vietnam as planned.

I was also away for a week, but had limited use of a computer.  I just printed some 2007 puzzles that I had been working on and took them on my trip.  I got back yesterday and am only three puzzles behind!

"Dangerous?" Your post is a gross exaggeration.
http://www.npr.org/sections/ombudsman/2016/05/18/478579787/fact-checking...

Trump is promising wars with Mexico and China, and hinting at another war with Vietnam.

He also flat out lied through his teeth for six months straight about being self funding and not having a Super PAC. He claims he is a great businessman but won't let us see his financials.

He's a fraud. His own supporters admit he's a con-artist. His supporters !

He also admitted to bribing his Republican opponents - no wonder they didn't bother going after him until the race was over.
"Why don't they just start a party."? Then you'll accuse them of "pulling a Nader"!
Yep.  Aside from losing the popular vote, and the pledged delegate numbers, and...

Apparently the nominee should be determined by whose campaign is telling the truth about the chairs.

And whoever the Times backs, vote for the other guy because the Times are evil, so the other guy must be good.
@John - We already have chaos and anarchy thanks to the Tea Party for the last several years.
Rolling Stone interviewed a few Sanders supporters who were quite proud of their actions, owned it entirely.
Unfortunately, the DNC doesn't want to expand its base if that means undermining its neoliberal ("centrist") ideology.

After 10 months of reading "I'm a minority woman who voted for Obama twice, but I can't support Hillary because of the e-mails and all those scandals, so I'm voting Trump", now you know what it feels like.
Total nonsense. Sanders and his worshippers just don't like them because they're losing.
MVH1, the same argument would apply if you were talking about the Bolshevik party. Democracy is more than a party machine.

YES -

http://www.npr.org/sections/ombudsman/2016/05/18/478579787/fact-checking...
@Brandon - What "rule changing" exactly?  Too many conspiracy theorists in the Sanders camp in my opinion.

I have no idea if Rafael Cruz had any affiliation with the various anti-Castro Cuban groups funded by the CIA in the early 1960's but for anyone to even reference the Warren Commission as some kind of authority on President Kennedy's assassination is laughable.  Members of the Warren Commission such as former prosecutor and Senator Richard Russell privately dissented from the "magic bullet" theory.  Warren Commission member Hale Boggs stated FBI chief J. Edgar Hoover lied his eyes out to the Warren Commission.  Anyone who is familiar with the Church Committee investigations of the 1970's into the Kennedy and King assassinations know that the Warren Commission explanation was solely a political solution and cover-up that LBJ, J. Edgar Hoover and Allen Dulles believed was necessary for 'national security' reasons.

It's the advice he's giving Sanders, and the casual way he minimized the threats of violence from Sanders' supporters toward Ms. Lange in Nevada.  "We know where your grandchildren go to school" --- really, Weaver is not doing Bernie any favors by brushing that off as nothing.

Bernie has tarnished his own character with baseless attacks on Hillary, and giving a weak, vague response to his supporters' threats in Nevada.  Sorry, but he's lost his moral compass and his judgement has slipped.

How sadly ironic. 50 years ago in the Vietnam War we pushed the North Vietnamese into the arms of China and Russia. Now we are proposing to protect them from China and they want to be more independent of Russia.

50,000 of our soldiers, including my best friend, and hundreds of thousands of Vietnamese died in that disaster caused by neocons including Dulles, McNamara, Westmoreland, LBJ, Bush Sr. sold the phony "domino theory" to justify the war, and other war criminals, Nixon & Kissinger expanded the war into Cambodia with their disastrous, phony plan to end the war.
Now we are going to rescue the Vietnamese from the Chinese and enhance our control in Southeast Asia. Good Grief!
